// Destroying a session
function logout() {
    session_start();
    
    // Unset all session variables
    $_SESSION = [];
    
    // Destroy the session
    if (ini_get("session.use_cookies")) {
        $params = session_get_cookie_params();
        setcookie(session_name(), '', time() - 42000,
            $params["path"], $params["domain"],
            $params["secure"], $params["httponly"]
        );
    }
    
    session_destroy();
    
    // Redirect to login page
    header('Location: login.php');
    exit;
}

<?php
// Basic class definition
class User {
    // Properties (attributes)
    public string $name;
    public string $email;
    private string $password;
    protected int $userId;
    
    // Constructor
    public function __construct(string $name, string $email, string $password) {
        $this->name = $name;
        $this->email = $email;
        $this->setPassword($password);
        $this->userId = rand(1000, 9999);
    }
    
    // Methods (behaviors)
    public function setPassword(string $password): void {
        $this->password = password_hash($password, PASSWORD_DEFAULT);
    }
    
    public function verifyPassword(string $password): bool {
        return password_verify($password, $this->password);
    }
    
    public function getProfile(): array {
        return [
            'name' => $this->name,
            'email' => $this->email,
            'user_id' => $this->userId
        ];
    }
    
    // Static method
    public static function createFromArray(array $data): self {
        return new self($data['name'], $data['email'], $data['password']);
    }
}

// Using the class
$user = new User('John Doe', 'john@example.com', 'secret123');

echo $user->name;  // John Doe
// echo $user->password;  // Error: cannot access private property

// Verify password
if ($user->verifyPassword('secret123')) {
    echo "Password correct!";
}

// Get profile
$profile = $user->getProfile();
print_r($profile);

// Static method call
$user2 = User::createFromArray([
    'name' => 'Jane Doe',
    'email' => 'jane@example.com',
    'password' => 'password123'
]);

// Inheritance
class Admin extends User {
    public array $permissions = [];
    
    public function __construct(string $name, string $email, string $password, array $permissions) {
        parent::__construct($name, $email, $password);
        $this->permissions = $permissions;
    }
    
    public function hasPermission(string $permission): bool {
        return in_array($permission, $this->permissions);
    }
    
    // Overriding parent method
    public function getProfile(): array {
        $profile = parent::getProfile();
        $profile['role'] = 'admin';
        $profile['permissions'] = $this->permissions;
        return $profile;
    }
}

$admin = new Admin('Admin User', 'admin@example.com', 'adminpass', ['create', 'update', 'delete']);

if ($admin->hasPermission('delete')) {
    echo "Admin can delete users";

<?php
// Interface definition
interface LoggerInterface {
    public function log(string $message, string $level = 'info'): void;
    public function getLogs(): array;
}

interface NotifiableInterface {
    public function sendNotification(string $message): bool;
}

// Trait definition
trait Timestampable {
    protected ?DateTime $createdAt = null;
    protected ?DateTime $updatedAt = null;
    
    public function setCreatedAt(DateTime $date): void {
        $this->createdAt = $date;
    }
    
    public function setUpdatedAt(DateTime $date): void {
        $this->updatedAt = $date;
    }
    
    public function getCreatedAt(): ?DateTime {
        return $this->createdAt;
    }
}

trait Loggable {
    protected array $logs = [];
    
    public function addLog(string $message): void {
        $this->logs[] = [
            'message' => $message,
            'timestamp' => new DateTime()
        ];
    }
    
    public function getLogs(): array {
        return $this->logs;
    }
}

// Class implementing interfaces and using traits
class FileLogger implements LoggerInterface, NotifiableInterface {
    use Timestampable, Loggable;
    
    private string $logFile;
    
    public function __construct(string $logFile) {
        $this->logFile = $logFile;
        $this->setCreatedAt(new DateTime());
    }
    
    public function log(string $message, string $level = 'info'): void {
        $logEntry = "[$level] " . (new DateTime())->format('Y-m-d H:i:s') . " - $message\n";
        file_put_contents($this->logFile, $logEntry, FILE_APPEND);
        $this->addLog($message);
    }
    
    public function sendNotification(string $message): bool {
        // Simulate sending notification
        $this->log("Notification sent: $message", 'notification');
        return true;
    }
}

// Abstract class
abstract class DatabaseModel {
    protected string $table;
    protected array $attributes = [];
    
    abstract public function save(): bool;
    abstract public function delete(): bool;
    
    public function setAttributes(array $data): void {
        $this->attributes = array_merge($this->attributes, $data);
    }
    
    public function getAttributes(): array {
        return $this->attributes;
    }
}

<?php
// PSR-1: Basic Coding Standard
// - Files MUST use only <?php and <?= tags
// - Files MUST use only UTF-8 without BOM
// - Files SHOULD either declare symbols or have side-effects, but not both
// - Namespaces and classes MUST follow PSR-4
// - Class names MUST be declared in StudlyCaps
// - Class constants MUST be declared in all upper case with underscore separators
// - Method names MUST be declared in camelCase

// PSR-4: Autoloading Standard
namespace Vendor\Package;

use Vendor\Package\ClassA;
use Vendor\Package\ClassB as AliasedClassB;
use Vendor\Package\Sub\Namespaces\ClassC;

class Example
{
    public function sampleMethod($a, $b = null)
    {
        if ($a === $b) {
            bar();
        } elseif ($a > $b) {
            $foo->bar($arg1);
        } else {
            BazClass::bar($arg2, $arg3);
        }
    }
    
    final public static function bar()
    {
        // method body
    }
}

// PSR-12: Extended Coding Style
namespace Vendor\Package;

use Vendor\Package\FirstClass;
use Vendor\Package\SecondClass;
use Vendor\Package\ThirdClass as ThirdAlias;

class ClassName extends ParentClass implements \ArrayAccess, \Countable
{
    // constants, properties, methods
    
    public function sampleFunction(int $a, int $b = null): array
    {
        if ($a === $b) {
            bar();
        } elseif ($a > $b) {
            $foo->bar($arg1);
        } else {
            ThirdAlias::bar($arg2, $arg3);
        }
        
        // Match expression (PSR-12 compliant)
        $result = match ($a) {
            1 => 'one',
            2 => 'two',
            default => 'many',
        };
        
        return [];
    }
    
    final public static function bar()
    {
        // method body
    }
}

// Other important PSR standards:
// PSR-3: Logger Interface
// PSR-6: Caching Interface
// PSR-7: HTTP Message Interface
// PSR-11: Container Interface
// PSR-15: HTTP Handlers
// PSR-16: Simple Cache

// Example implementing PSR-3 Logger
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;

class MyService
{
    private LoggerInterface $logger;
    
    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }
    
    public function doSomething(): void
    {
        $this->logger->info('Doing something');
        
        try {
            // Some operation
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            $this->logger->error('An error occurred', ['exception' => $e]);
        }
    }
}

<?php
// Database configuration
class DatabaseConfig {
    const HOST = 'localhost';
    const DBNAME = 'myapp';
    const USERNAME = 'root';
    const PASSWORD = 'password';
    const CHARSET = 'utf8mb4';
}

// Database connection class
class Database {
    private static ?PDO $connection = null;
    
    public static function getConnection(): PDO {
        if (self::$connection === null) {
            $dsn = "mysql:host=" . DatabaseConfig::HOST . ";dbname=" . DatabaseConfig::DBNAME . ";charset=" . DatabaseConfig::CHARSET;
            
            $options = [
                PDO::ATTR_ERRMODE => PDO::ERRMODE_EXCEPTION,
                PDO::ATTR_DEFAULT_FETCH_MODE => PDO::FETCH_ASSOC,
                PDO::ATTR_EMULATE_PREPARES => false,
            ];
            
            try {
                self::$connection = new PDO($dsn, DatabaseConfig::USERNAME, DatabaseConfig::PASSWORD, $options);
            } catch (PDOException $e) {
                throw new PDOException($e->getMessage(), (int)$e->getCode());
            }
        }
        
        return self::$connection;
    }
}

// User model with database operations
class UserModel {
    private PDO $db;
    
    public function __construct() {
        $this->db = Database::getConnection();
    }
    
    // Create user
    public function create(array $userData): bool {
        $sql = "INSERT INTO users (name, email, password, created_at) VALUES (:name, :email, :password, NOW())";
        
        $stmt = $this->db->prepare($sql);
        
        return $stmt->execute([
            'name' => $userData['name'],
            'email' => $userData['email'],
            'password' => password_hash($userData['password'], PASSWORD_DEFAULT)
        ]);
    }
    
    // Find user by ID
    public function findById(int $id): ?array {
        $sql = "SELECT id, name, email, created_at FROM users WHERE id = :id";
        
        $stmt = $this->db->prepare($sql);
        $stmt->execute(['id' => $id]);
        
        $user = $stmt->fetch();
        return $user ?: null;
    }
    
    // Find user by email
    public function findByEmail(string $email): ?array {
        $sql = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = :email";
        
        $stmt = $this->db->prepare($sql);
        $stmt->execute(['email' => $email]);
        
        $user = $stmt->fetch();
        return $user ?: null;
    }
    
    // Update user
    public function update(int $id, array $userData): bool {
        $allowedFields = ['name', 'email'];
        $updates = [];
        $params = ['id' => $id];
        
        foreach ($userData as $field => $value) {
            if (in_array($field, $allowedFields)) {
                $updates[] = "$field = :$field";
                $params[$field] = $value;
            }
        }
        
        if (empty($updates)) {
            return false;
        }
        
        $sql = "UPDATE users SET " . implode(', ', $updates) . " WHERE id = :id";
        $stmt = $this->db->prepare($sql);
        
        return $stmt->execute($params);
    }
    
    // Delete user
    public function delete(int $id): bool {
        $sql = "DELETE FROM users WHERE id = :id";
        $stmt = $this->db->prepare($sql);
        
        return $stmt->execute(['id' => $id]);
    }
    
    // Get all users with pagination
    public function getAll(int $page = 1, int $perPage = 10): array {
        $offset = ($page - 1) * $perPage;
        
        $sql = "SELECT id, name, email, created_at FROM users ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT :limit OFFSET :offset";
        
        $stmt = $this->db->prepare($sql);
        $stmt->bindValue('limit', $perPage, PDO::PARAM_INT);
        $stmt->bindValue('offset', $offset, PDO::PARAM_INT);
        $stmt->execute();
        
        return $stmt->fetchAll();
    }
    
    // Search users
    public function search(string $query, int $page = 1, int $perPage = 10): array {
        $offset = ($page - 1) * $perPage;
        $searchTerm = "%$query%";
        
        $sql = "SELECT id, name, email, created_at FROM users 
                WHERE name LIKE :query OR email LIKE :query 
                ORDER BY created_at DESC 
                LIMIT :limit OFFSET :offset";
        
        $stmt = $this->db->prepare($sql);
        $stmt->bindValue('query', $searchTerm);
        $stmt->bindValue('limit', $perPage, PDO::PARAM_INT);
        $stmt->bindValue('offset', $offset, PDO::PARAM_INT);
        $stmt->execute();
        
        return $stmt->fetchAll();
    }
}

// Create user

    'name' => 'John Doe',

namespace Tests\Unit;

use PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase;

    public function testCanCreateUserWithValidData(): void
    {
        // Arrange
        $userData = [
            'name' => 'John Doe',
            'email' => 'john@example.com',
            'password' => 'password123'
        ];
        
        $expectedUser = new User($userData);
        
        $this->userRepositoryMock
            ->expects($this->once())
            ->method('create')
            ->with($this->equalTo($userData))
            ->willReturn($expectedUser);
        
        // Act
        $result = $this->userService->createUser($userData);
        
        // Assert
        $this->assertInstanceOf(User::class, $result);
        $this->assertEquals('John Doe', $result->getName());
        $this->assertEquals('john@example.com', $result->getEmail());
    }
    
    public function testCannotCreateUserWithInvalidEmail(): void
    {
        // Arrange
        $invalidUserData = [
            'name' => 'John Doe',
            'email' => 'invalid-email',
            'password' => 'password123'
        ];
        
        $this->expectException(\InvalidArgumentException::class);
        $this->expectExceptionMessage('Invalid email address');
        
        // Act
        $this->userService->createUser($invalidUserData);
    }
    
    public function testCanFindUserById(): void
    {

        $userId = 1;

        $this->userRepositoryMock
            ->expects($this->once())
            ->method('findById')
            ->with($this->equalTo($userId))
            ->willReturn($expectedUser);
        
        // Act
        $result = $this->userService->getUserById($userId);

        $this->userRepositoryMock
            ->expects($this->once())
            ->method('findById')
            ->with($this->equalTo($nonExistentUserId))
            ->willReturn(null);
        
        // Act
        $result = $this->userService->getUserById($nonExistentUserId);
        
        // Assert
        $this->assertNull($result);

class ApiClient {
    public function request($method, $url, $data = []) {
        $context = stream_context_create([
            'http' => [
                'method' => $method,
                'header' => 'Content-type: application/json',
                'content' => json_encode($data),
                'ignore_errors' => true
            ]
        ]);
        
        $response = file_get_contents($url, false, $context);
        
        // Log for debugging

            'url' => $url,
            'data' => $data,
            'response' => $response,
            'http_response_header' => $http_response_header
        ], 'API_REQUEST');

// 7. Performance debugging
class PerformanceDebugger {
    private static $timers = [];
    private static $memoryUsage = [];
    
    public static function startTimer($name): void {
        self::$timers[$name] = microtime(true);
        self::$memoryUsage[$name] = memory_get_usage(true);
    }
    
    public static function endTimer($name): array {
        if (!isset(self::$timers[$name])) {
            return [];
        }
        
        $endTime = microtime(true);
        $endMemory = memory_get_usage(true);
        
        $executionTime = $endTime - self::$timers[$name];
        $memoryUsed = $endMemory - self::$memoryUsage[$name];
        
        $result = [
            'execution_time' => round($executionTime * 1000, 2) . 'ms',
            'memory_used' => round($memoryUsed / 1024 / 1024, 2) . 'MB',
            'peak_memory' => round(memory_get_peak_usage(true) / 1024 / 1024, 2) . 'MB'
        ];
        
        debug($result, "PERFORMANCE: $name");
        
        unset(self::$timers[$name], self::$memoryUsage[$name]);
        
        return $result;
    }
}

// Usage:

// ... database operations ...
$performance = PerformanceDebugger::endTimer('database_operation');

version: '3.8'

services:

    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    image: my-php-app
    container_name: php_app
    restart: unless-stopped
    working_dir: /var/www/
    volumes:
      - ./:/var/www
      - ./php/php.ini:/usr/local/etc/php/php.ini
    networks:
      - app-network

  webserver:
    image: nginx:alpine
    container_name: nginx_server
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "80:80"
      - "443:443"
    volumes:
      - ./:/var/www
      - ./nginx/conf.d/:/etc/nginx/conf.d/
    networks:
      - app-network

  db:
    image: mysql:8.0
    container_name: mysql_db
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MYSQL_DATABASE: ${DB_DATABASE}
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD}
      MYSQL_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD}
      MYSQL_USER: ${DB_USERNAME}
    volumes:
      - dbdata:/var/lib/mysql
      - ./mysql/init.sql:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/init.sql
    networks:
      - app-network

  redis:

    container_name: redis_cache
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
    networks:
      - app-network

volumes:

    driver: local

networks:

    driver: bridge

# nginx/conf.d/app.conf
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name localhost;
    root /var/www/public;
    index index.php index.html;

    location / {
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$query_string;
    }

    location ~ \.php$ {
        fastcgi_pass app:9000;
        fastcgi_index index.php;
        fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $document_root$fastcgi_script_name;
        include fastcgi_params;
    }

    location ~ /\.ht {
        deny all;
    }

    # Security headers
    add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN" always;
    add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block" always;
    add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff" always;
    add_header Referrer-Policy "no-referrer-when-downgrade" always;
    add_header Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self' http: https: data: blob: 'unsafe-inline'" always;
}
